measured_by: proportion of risky lottery choices / economic decision-making task with risky lotteries
justification: “We quantified individuals' attitudes toward risk … calculating the proportion of times participants chose the risky lottery over a certain option … This provided an estimate of participants' risk attitudes.”
construct: Risk preference / Risk tolerance / Risk attitude

measured_by: proportion of ambiguous lottery choices (risk-corrected) / economic decision-making task with ambiguous lotteries
justification: “Similarly, we calculated the proportion of trials for which participants chose the ambiguous lottery choices as a model-free … index of ambiguity attitudes.”
construct: Ambiguity preference / Ambiguity tolerance / Ambiguity aversion

measured_by: Stress and Adversity Inventory for Adults (STRAIN)
justification: “To quantify participants' cumulative lifetime exposure to stress, we used the well-validated Stress and Adversity Inventory for Adults (STRAIN).”

measured_by: early-life subsection of the STRAIN (stressors prior to age 18)
justification: “We examined how the timing of individuals' stress exposure (early life vs. adulthood) related to ambiguous lottery choice… using the STRAIN to identify stressors experienced early in life (i.e., prior to age 18).”
“IQ scores were estimated using an online version of the Raven's Progressive Matrices (RPM) … a test widely used … to measure abstract reasoning and non-verbal fluid intelligence.”
“Participants reported their … mental health status using the Psychological Distress Inventory (K-6), which is a self-report survey that measures psychological distress over the past month.”
